stages.title: NEBULA
stages.description: A cloud of gas and dust collapses under gravity, beginning star formation.

stages.title: PROTOSTAR
stages.description: The forming star heats up as it gathers mass, but fusion has not yet begun.

stages.title: LOW MASS MAIN SEQUENCE
stages.description: A small star steadily fuses hydrogen and can live for billions of years.

stages.title: RED GIANT
stages.description: Hydrogen is exhausted, causing the star to expand and cool.

stages.title: PLANETARY NEBULA
stages.description: Outer layers are expelled into space, leaving the core behind.

stages.title: WHITE DWARF
stages.description: The core remains as a dense white dwarf.

stages.title: BLACK DWARF
stages.description: The stellar core cools over trillions of years into a black dwarf.

stages.title: HIGH MASS MAIN SEQUENCE
stages.description: A massive star burns fuel rapidly and has a short lifespan.

stages.title: SUPERGIANT
stages.description: The star expands as it fuses heavier elements in its core.

stages.title: SUPERNOVA
stages.description: The core collapses, causing a catastrophic stellar explosion.

stages.title: NEUTRON STAR
stages.description: If the remaining core is 1.4â€“3 solar masses, it becomes a neutron star.

stages.title: BLACK HOLE
stages.description: If the core is above ~3 solar masses, it collapses into a black hole.
